#Text=Castletownberehaven
#Text=Castletownberehaven is in County Cork .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Castletownberehaven , also known as Castletownbere or Castletown for short .
#Text=It is located in the middle of the Beara Peninsula .
#Text=This picturesque town has a population of about 868 ( 2006 census ) .
#Text=It is a chief fishing port in Ireland and consequently fishing is the main economic activity .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Bantry , head west firstly on the N71 and take a left in Glengariff onto the R572 , which will lead directly to Castletownbere .
#Text=Total distance is about .
#Text=The travelling time by car from Cork city is about 2 hours or from Bantry it is about 45 minutes .
#Text=Cycling to the town is also possible .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Bus Éireann route 236 connects Castletownbere to Bantry and Cork ( runs on Mondays , Wednesdays , Fridays and Saturdays only ) .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walking is the best if you do n't have a car , as the town is small enough and the distances are n't too great .
#Text=Unfortunately , there are no taxis or bus services in the town .
#Text=See
#Text=Puxley Mansion , Dunboy ( West from the town . ) .
#Text=An elegant and large manor house previously owned by the Puxley family .
#Text=Burnt down by the IRA in 1920 and remained in this gutted from fire condition until about 2010 when renovations began to restore it to its former glory .
#Text=These renovations appear to be halted as of 2015 and the house is surrounded by barricades .
#Text=Located beside the ruins of Dunboy Castle .
#Text=Dunboy Castle , Dunboy .
#Text=Now only the ruins remain of this once powerful stronghold of the O'Sullivan Bere clan .
#Text=It was destroyed in the famous Siege of Dunboy in June 1602 .
#Text=Glebe Graveyard , Eskenacartan/Drom North ( West of town . ) .
#Text=An old Church of Ireland graveyard that has n't received new burials since the mid 19th century .
#Text=Some of the gravestones are still legible .
#Text=At the west wall , there is a mass famine grave from the famine of the 1840s .
#Text=Do
#Text=Take a ferry to Bere Island .
#Text=Early morning to late evening .
#Text=Get a car ferry from opposite Murphy 's SuperValu to Bere Island opposite .
#Text=There are many things to see on Bere Island , including Martello Towers , a museum and the village of Rerrin .
#Text=Cycling .
#Text=The town and the surrounding area are great and scenic places to cycle , weather permitting .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Donegan 's Spar , Main St , ☏ +35327470027 .
#Text=For general purchases and essentials .
#Text=Murphy 's SuperValu , Main St , ☏ +3532770020 .
#Text=For general purchases and essentials .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The Copper Kettle , Main Square , Castletownbere , ☏ +3532771792 .
#Text=10:00-17:00. Pleasant little cafe with hefty portions and excellent home baking on offer .
#Text=Olde Bakery .
#Text=M - Sa 17:30 - 21:30 , Su 12:00-16:30. One of the best restaurants in the town .
#Text=Good value portions of standard food but seafood dishes are the best on offer .
#Text=Drink
#Text=MacCarthy 's Bar , Main St , ☏ +3532770014 .
#Text=Iconic pub and subject of an eponymous book by Pete McCarthy .
#Text=Is also a grocery shop .
#Text=Frequent live music and a snug inside the front door .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=The Beara Coast Hotel , Cametringane Point , ☏ +3532771446 , ✉ reception@bearacoast.com .
